item.title: interviews_after_break
item.description: Hey, I have started this blog to log my interview experiences especially after having a break. I had 5 months break in my career. You can find more details about my work experience in another blog. I also found a better way to get referrals and news about job openings in better companies. More about this at the end of this blog. The order of Interviews I attended: Samsung Research and Development Institute Of Bangalore: There is an entire blog on it, you can find it here
item.content:
Hey,

I have started this blog to log my interview experiences especially after having a break. I had 5 months break in my career. You can find more details about my work experience in another blog. I also found a better way to get referrals and news about job openings in better companies. More about this at the end of this blog.

The order of Interviews I attended:

Samsung Research and Development Institute Of Bangalore:

There is an entire blog on it, you can find it here

CredAvenue (Yubi):

One day a staff from intervue.io contacted me and describe me about the role, asked whether I am interested or not. He saw my profile on naukri. He scheduled a interview

Coding Round:

- Few problems on trees
- I am able to solve it and he asked few questions on trees.

Result: Passed

The recruiter on behalf of yubi scheduled another interview. He mentioned that it will on LLD, work-experience, coding

Tech Interview:

Result:

Shardeum:

Similarly like Yubi, but this time it is from ultragenius. Shardeum is on web3 platform which I am not interested. As it isn’t stable and which help green revolution.

But I just want to attend the interview for practise sake.

Meet with Ultragenius:

She describe the role and responsbilities. She also gave information about the whole process and prerequisities needed. I clearly understood, it doesn’t fit to me.

Meet with Shardeum:

This is a introductory call from shardeum to explain more about the company and to know my work-experiences basically more about me.

Finbox.ai:

Similar fashion,

Coding Interview:

Need to arrange the elements in the array according to freq in decreasing order and 
if the freq is same then the order should be similar to orginal order.

input:  [5, 2, 3, 3, 2, 4, 2, -1]
output: [2, 2, 2, 3, 3, 5, 4, -1]

I solved it and he asked the time complexity,testcases, test function

Result:

Qube Cinemas:

I have applied it on LinkedIn for golang backend role. The recruter sent a mail with the assesment of deadline 1 week(better to complete ASAP)

The assement is here. Solution is in v1 branch (refer Usage.md in v1)

Result:

Platforms:

  • Naukri
  • LinkedIn
  • Almaconnect (Best as you will get referrals along with the new opening news, also quick hiring process, you also get the news earlier than naukri and LinkedIn)

item.title: Javascript_tutorial
item.description: Javascript was only used in browsers to build interactive sites. Dahl build a cpp program which is present in chrome as v8 engine to run javascript and it is called as node To run js on browser browser->inspect->console To printout the statements console.log("Hello","World"); The variables are created by var or let keyword Scope of var is functional Scope of let is block {} constants can be created by const keyword
item.content:
Javascript was only used in browsers to build interactive sites. Dahl build a cpp program which is present in chrome as v8 engine to run javascript and it is called as node

To run js on browser browser->inspect->console

To printout the statements

console.log("Hello","World");

The variables are created by var or let keyword Scope of var is functional Scope of let is block {}

constants can be created by const keyword

Types of variables:

  • Primitive Types
    • String
    • Number
    • Boolean
    • null (to mark the variable as empty)
    • undefined (default type if the value of variable isn’t defined)
  • Reference Types
    • Object
    • Array
    • Functions

To know the type of a variable:

console.log(typeof color);

Object:

Arrays: In js, arrays functions as stack,queue and lists. Addressing uses zero-based indices. Arrays in JS are sparse, meaning that we can also assign variables to random locations even though prev cells were undefined. It can have elements with different types.

var myArray = [1,2,3];
var arr = new Array(1,2,3);
console.log(myArray[0]);
var arr1 = [undefined, undefined, 1, "hello"];

Stacks,Queues,Lists:

Arrays has push,pop,shiftandunshift methods.

push -> inserts at the end of the array pop -> removes at the end of the array shift -> inserts at the start of the array unshift -> removes at the start of the array

By using push,pop or shift,unshift arrays can behave as stacks With push,shift or unshift,pop it can behave as queues

Splicing:

In JS, we can split the array into two by using splice

var arr = [1,2,3,4,5,6,7,8,,9,0];
var child = arr.splice(3,5); // startingIndex, length of child array
console.log(child);
console.log(arr);

Operators:

Addition operator (+): It is used to add numbers and also for concatenation of strings. If + is used in b/w string and other data type, then other data type is converted into string js var a =1,b=2; var c = a=b; var name = "John"; console.log("Hello "+name); //Hello John console.log("hey "+34); // hey 34 Similarly -,*,/,% are for subtraction, multiplication, division and modulus JS also supports combination of above operators with equal i.e +=, -=, *=, /=,%=

JS has Math module which contains - Math.abs (absolute value) - Math.exp (calculates e to the power) - Math.pow(x,y) (calculates the result of x to the power of y) - Math.floor removes the fraction part from the number - Math.random() will give a random number x where 0<=x<1

Conditions:

if (1 == 1){
    console.log(true);
} else {
    console.log(false);
}

console.log("1" == 1); //true
console.log("1" === 1); //false compares types along with the values (strict comparision)

comparision: ==, ===, >,<,!,||,&&

Switch:

var rank = "Commander";
switch(rank)
{
    case "Private":
    case "Sergeant":
        console.log("You are not authorized.");
        break;
    case "Commander":
        console.log("Hello commander! what can I do for you today?");
        break;
    case "Captain":
        console.log("Hello captain! I will do anything you wish.");
        break;
    default:
        console.log("I don't know what your rank is.");
        break;
}

Loops:

item.title: SRIB interview experience
item.description: Hi, Today, I want to share the whole interview process of SRIB, I went through. It started in June 2022 with a call from a 3rd party consultant after a long break. He called me on behalf of Samsung Research and Development Institute of Bangalore. He was interested in my naukri profile. They conducted the test on 18th June. I did just average, some of the testcases didn’t pass TLE :( (I don’t remember the time and memory constraints)
item.content:
Hi,

Today, I want to share the whole interview process of SRIB, I went through.

It started in June 2022 with a call from a 3rd party consultant after a long break. He called me on behalf of Samsung Research and Development Institute of Bangalore. He was interested in my naukri profile.

They conducted the test on 18th June. I did just average, some of the testcases didn’t pass TLE :( (I don’t remember the time and memory constraints)

Given the set of rod lengths (duplicates are allowed). I need to find two disjoint
subsets with same sum and need to maximize the sum. I just need to output the maximum
sum.
Example:  {1,2,3,4}. The subsets can be {1,3} and {4}; {1,4} and {2,3}. 
Here output should be 5

They gave me a chance to retake the test on 25th June. This time, I have cleared the test:)

Assume Top-left corner as 0,0 and x-axis on horizontal and y-axis vertically.
The input will be the n plot co-ordinates(top left corner and bottom right). Here all
the plots are in rectangle shape and they may share the same edge but there won't be 
any overlapping area. We need to find the maximum possible square plot size that can 
be formed by these n plots such that
i)    There shouldn't be any area inside the square which isn't among the n plots.
ii)   There shouldn't be any plot such that only a part of it is inside the square.

Finally, I got an amazon voucher worth of 5000 for clearing the test and a suprise interview on 29th June.

- Asked me about JS
- OOP
- Implementing Stack using Linked list
- My work experience at previous companies
- Data Structures Stack vs queue, hashmap vs trie, array vs linkedlist ....

Result: Passed

It seems the JS is mandatory for the role, there are interviewing and I didn’t have much experience. I asked the recuriter before the interview about the JD and he didn’t shared it and said he too didn’t know. The role I was interviewed is for Voice Intelligence team(I asked the interviewer at end of interview)

Take-aways:

  • Should know the JD well
  • Mock Interview (would have improved my performance)

Then recruiter called me on 30th June and he scheduled a meet on 1st July with HR. I expected the meet will be on behaviorial,my work experience, discussing about package, and the joining date.

- Asked me about my work experiences
- Issues I faced in my prev work
- 3 Toughest challengers I faced in work
- 3 things I liked in my prev company
- My proudest moment in my prev company
- My career goals and interests
- Higher Education
- When can I join?
- Expected package?

Result: Passed

It seems it went well, atleast I am statisfied with it.

Finally, the recruiter called me on 4th July and scheduled an interview with Voice Intelligence Team Director on 5th July.

- Asked about my work experiences
- My interests and domain I like
- Describe the role and the responsibilities
- He thought my interests won't allign with the role and said he will let me know  
after some internal discussion with the team.

Finally I was ghosted. The recruiter should have shared the JD and he should have given the choice as there are many teams which are hiring inside SRIB. Thanks to the recruiter, now I am not able to reach them.
